text: The Seohae Bridge () is a cable-stayed bridge that connects Pyongtaek and Dangjin, South Korea. Bridge construction started in 1993 and was completed in 2000 at a cost of 677.7 billion won. A prop (and some precast segments) fell on August 5, 1999 under construction due to Typhoon Olga. The bridge opened on November 9, 2000. ==See also== *List of Korea-related topics *Transportation in South Korea *List of longest cable-stayed bridge spans == References == Category:Bridges in South Korea Category:Bridges completed in 2000 Category:Pyeongtaek Category:Dangjin Category:Buildings and structures in Gyeonggi Province Category:Transport in Gyeonggi Province Category:Buildings and structures in South Chungcheong Province Category:Transport in South Chungcheong Province
title: Seohae Bridge
